headline.main: Q&A: What the Supreme Court's Gay Marriage Ruling Means
headline.print_headline: Q&A: What the Supreme Court's Gay Marriage Ruling Means

docs.snippet: The decades-long debate about whether same-sex marriage should be allowed in the United States was finally settled Friday when the U.S. Supreme Court ruled gay and lesbian couples can get married anywhere in the country....
docs.lead_paragraph: The decades-long debate about whether same-sex marriage should be allowed in the United States was finally settled Friday when the U.S. Supreme Court ruled gay and lesbian couples can get married anywhere in the country.

headline.main: Poll Shows Divide Over Increasing Money for Transit
headline.print_headline: Poll Shows Divide Over Increasing Money for Transit

docs.snippet: A slight majority of Americans prefer living in a single-family house in the suburbs or a rural area with more land, even if it means driving long distances to get to work or run errands, according to a poll by The Associated Press-GfK....
docs.lead_paragraph: A slight majority of Americans prefer living in a single-family house in the suburbs or a rural area with more land, even if it means driving long distances to get to work or run errands, according to a poll by The Associated Press-GfK.

headline.main: Experts Say Untruthful Jurors Pose a Rare Hazard in Court
headline.print_headline: Experts Say Untruthful Jurors Pose a Rare Hazard in Court

docs.snippet: Guilty verdicts in some of the nation's most high-profile criminal cases have been thrown out recently because of jurors who were not truthful. But despite the recent problems with jurors, legal experts say these cases are the exception....
docs.lead_paragraph: Guilty verdicts in some of the nation's most high-profile criminal cases have been thrown out recently because of jurors who were not truthful. But despite the recent problems with jurors, legal experts say these cases are the exception.

headline.main: Avoiding Future Freeway Congestion Could Come With a Cost
headline.print_headline: Avoiding Future Freeway Congestion Could Come With a Cost

docs.snippet: Fewer of tomorrow's freeways will be free. In exchange, drivers willing and able to pay will avoid the traffic congestion that bedevils everyone else....
docs.lead_paragraph: Fewer of tomorrow's freeways will be free. In exchange, drivers willing and able to pay will avoid the traffic congestion that bedevils everyone else.

headline.main: Former Oklahoma Volunteer Deputy Waives Hearing
headline.print_headline: Former Oklahoma Volunteer Deputy Waives Hearing

docs.snippet: A former Oklahoma volunteer sheriff's deputy who fatally shot a restrained and unarmed man waived his right to a preliminary hearing Friday and was ordered to stand trial....
docs.lead_paragraph: A former Oklahoma volunteer sheriff's deputy who fatally shot a restrained and unarmed man waived his right to a preliminary hearing Friday and was ordered to stand trial.

headline.main: Jimmy Fallon Injures Hand, Cancels 'Tonight Show' Taping
headline.print_headline: Jimmy Fallon Injures Hand, Cancels 'Tonight Show' Taping

docs.snippet: Jimmy Fallon, host of NBC's "Tonight Show," had minor surgery after injuring his hand in his New York apartment, his representative said, forcing the cancellation of Friday's taping of the show....
docs.lead_paragraph: Jimmy Fallon, host of NBC's "Tonight Show," had minor surgery after injuring his hand in his New York apartment, his representative said, forcing the cancellation of Friday's taping of the show.

headline.main: Armstrong Still Plans to Ride Part of Tour Route: BBC
headline.print_headline: Armstrong Still Plans to Ride Part of Tour Route: BBC

docs.snippet: Disgraced cyclist Lance Armstrong is still planning to court controversy by riding part of the Tour de France route next month for charity, according to a BBC report....
docs.lead_paragraph: Disgraced cyclist Lance Armstrong is still planning to court controversy by riding part of the Tour de France route next month for charity, according to a BBC report.

headline.main: Same-Sex Marriage Still on Hold in Louisiana, Mississippi
headline.print_headline: Same-Sex Marriage Still on Hold in Louisiana, Mississippi

docs.snippet: Same-sex marriage remained on hold in Louisiana and Mississippi, even as a U.S. Supreme Court ruling on Friday legalizing it nationwide led to gay couples joyously tying the knot in other states that banned such weddings before the decision....
docs.lead_paragraph: Same-sex marriage remained on hold in Louisiana and Mississippi, even as a U.S. Supreme Court ruling on Friday legalizing it nationwide led to gay couples joyously tying the knot in other states that banned such weddings before the decision.

docs.snippet: Four bridges have collapsed in the northern Indian town of Sonprayag as heavy monsoon rains wreak havoc. Rudi Bakhtiar reports....
docs.lead_paragraph: Four bridges have collapsed in the northern Indian town of Sonprayag as heavy monsoon rains wreak havoc. Rudi Bakhtiar reports.

headline.main: Brazil Probe Pits Investigators Against Long-Protected Elite
headline.print_headline: Brazil Probe Pits Investigators Against Long-Protected Elite

docs.snippet: In a nation where the elite have enjoyed relative impunity, a new generation of police and prosecutors in Brazil are bent on using the country's largest-ever corruption investigation to send the message that no one is above the law....
docs.lead_paragraph: In a nation where the elite have enjoyed relative impunity, a new generation of police and prosecutors in Brazil are bent on using the country's largest-ever corruption investigation to send the message that no one is above the law.
